workflow.name: AI-powered SEO content optimization with SERP analysis & Slack approval workflow
workflow.description:
## üìä Description
Enhance content quality, SEO performance, and editorial consistency using an AI-powered optimization engine that blends OpenAI, Google Sheets history, Pinecone knowledge, and real-time SERP intelligence. This workflow transforms rough drafts into polished, SEO-optimized content while preserving original meaning ‚Äî and includes human review before final publication. üöÄ‚úçÔ∏è

## What This Template Does
- Step 1: Trigger the optimization from Chat or manual run: Starts the optimization process using the Chat Trigger node, passing topic, content ID, and customization parameters. üí¨
- Step 2: Retrieve contextual knowledge: Pulls historical versions from Google Sheets and relevant company information from Pinecone vector storage to guide consistent optimization. üìö
- Step 3: Fetch SERP competitor data: Uses SerpAPI to gather ranking competitors, headings, snippets, PAA questions, and search intent to strengthen the optimized draft. üîç
- Step 4: Run AI content optimization: AI Agent (GPT-4o-mini) rewrites the draft without starting from scratch, improving structure, SEO, tone, clarity, and keyword coverage. ü§ñ
- Step 5: Enforce structured JSON output: Ensures the optimized draft follows a strict JSON schema containing title, meta description, sections, keywords, and metadata. üß©
- Step 6: Request human review in Slack: Sends the optimized draft to Slack and waits for approval (approve/reject). Team members can refine or confirm before finalization. üí¨üßë‚Äçüíº
- Step 7: Save approved version back to Google Sheets: Updates or appends a new version in the content_versions sheet with metadata, SEO fields, and version history. üìä
- Step 8: Send success confirmation to Slack: Posts a notification confirming that the approved draft has been published. üîî

## Key Benefits
‚úì Eliminates manual editing and SEO refinement
 ‚úì Produces consistent, high-quality, conversion-focused content
 ‚úì Ensures factual accuracy and tone preservation
 ‚úì Enhances content using SERP-based competitor insights
 ‚úì Maintains version history for auditability
 ‚úì Introduces structured human approval workflow
 ‚úì Fully automated publishing pipeline

## Features
- AI-assisted rewrite using GPT-4o-mini
- Google Sheets version retrieval + updating
- Pinecone knowledge base retrieval
- SERP competitor and keyword intelligence
- Slack approval workflow (sendAndWait)
- Structured JSON output enforcement
- Version incrementing & metadata tracking
- Secure credentials management

## Requirements
- OpenAI API Key (GPT-4o-mini or higher)
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials
- SerpAPI Key
- Slack Bot Token with chat:write
- Pinecone API and vector index
- Pre-created Google Sheet for versioning
- Optional: Existing company knowledge stored in Pinecone

## Target Audience
1. SEO content teams optimizing blog drafts
2. Marketing teams refining landing pages
3. Agencies managing editorial workflows
4. Enterprises maintaining knowledge-based content
5. Writers/editorial teams that need AI assistance + human QA
6. Teams that require version-controlled SEO content

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect these credentials in n8n: OpenAI, Slack, Google Sheets, Pinecone, SerpAPI. üîê
- Replace Google Sheet ID in the Sheets nodes with your own.
- Ensure your Pinecone index exists and contains embeddings.
- Configure Slack channel ID for approvals and notifications.
- Update test topic/content ID in the Set Input Parameters node.
- Run a manual test to confirm SERP retrieval, data context, and AI output.
- Deploy and use Chat Trigger to start generating optimized content on demand.

workflow.name: Optimize SEO Draft Content Using AI with Google Sheets, SERP Data & Slack Approval

parameters.content:
## üéØ AI-Powered SEO Content Optimizer

### How it works
This workflow takes existing SEO drafts and enhances them using AI, SERP analysis, and historical data. The AI Agent retrieves context from Google Sheets and Pinecone, analyzes competitor content via SerpAPI, then produces an optimized version with improved keywords, structure, and readability. Once optimized, it sends the draft to Slack for human approval before saving.

### Setup steps
1. **Connect credentials**: OpenAI API, Google Sheets OAuth2, SerpAPI, Slack OAuth, Pinecone API
2. **Configure Google Sheet**: Update document ID to point to your `content_versions` sheet
3. **Set Pinecone index**: Ensure your knowledge base index exists and contains relevant content
4. **Test with sample**: Use the Edit Fields node to input a test topic and content ID
5. **Approve in Slack**: Respond to the approval message to finalize the optimized content

The workflow preserves your original meaning while enhancing SEO performance using real-time competitor insights.

## üöÄ Entry Point & Test Data

Starts the workflow via chat trigger and injects test parameters. Modify the Edit Fields node to change topic, content ID, or optimization goals for your content.

## üß† AI Optimization Engine

The core agent combines OpenAI GPT-4o-mini with multiple tools: Google Sheets for historical versions, SerpAPI for competitor analysis, and Pinecone for company knowledge. It optimizes content while preserving factual accuracy and original intent.

## üíæ Data Tools & Context

These nodes provide the AI agent with context: past content versions from Sheets, SERP intelligence from Google, and company-specific knowledge from Pinecone vector storage. Short-term memory maintains conversation continuity.

## ‚úÖ Human Approval & Publishing

Optimized content is sent to Slack for review. Team members can approve or reject. Approved content gets saved to Google Sheets with versioning metadata and triggers a success notification.

## üîê Credentials & Security

Required credentials: OpenAI API key, Google Sheets OAuth2, SerpAPI key, Slack OAuth, Pinecone API key. Use environment variables or n8n credential manager. Never hardcode keys in production workflows.

options.systemMessage:
=You are "Optimization Agent", a senior content optimizer AI inside an n8n automation system built by Vivek Patidar.

Your job:
Improve the provided draft WITHOUT rewriting it from scratch by using:
1. The existing draft text from the workflow input
2. Historical versions from Google Sheets ("content_versions")
3. SERP intelligence from SerpAPI (competitors, headings, snippets, PAA, related searches)
4. Brief or metadata passed from the previous stage

You must produce a refined, SEO-optimized, well-structured and factually consistent version of the draft.

--------------------------------
üìé HOW TO USE SERP DATA
--------------------------------
You receive SERP data via upstream tools (SerpAPI). Use it to:

- Identify missing topical sections compared to competitors.
- Enhance keyword coverage and semantic depth.
- Improve H2/H3 section clarity and completeness.
- Strengthen meta description using competitor insight.
- Suggest improvements based on PAA questions (People Also Ask).
- Add missing angles/topics found across rankings.
- Improve EEAT signals (expertise, trustworthiness) when relevant.
- DO NOT output any raw SERP JSON.

SERP data should influence optimization decisions, but never override the original meaning of the draft.

--------------------------------
üìù OPTIMIZATION RULES
--------------------------------
1. **Never rewrite from scratch.** Always keep the core meaning and structure.
2. **Preserve tone** from the original draft or brief.
3. **Preserve factual accuracy** ‚Äì no hallucinations.
4. **Only improve**, refine, reorganize, expand, clarify, or SEO-enhance.
5. **Use keywords naturally**, avoid keyword stuffing.
6. **If brief or previous versions exist**, align with them.
7. **If SERP data suggests missed content**, incorporate it softly into relevant sections.
8. **If the draft is messy**, reorganize into sections while preserving original paragraphs as much as possible.
9. **Never expose intermediate reasoning** or tool data.

--------------------------------
üßæ VERSIONING LOGIC
--------------------------------
Use Google Sheets context to determine versioning:

- If content_id already exists:
  - Increment version_no (ex: 2 ‚Üí 3)
  - Create new version_id as "VER-00X"_

parameters.text: =Your {{ $('AI Content Optimization Agent').item.json.output.optimized_draft.title }}  has been Successfully Optimized.

parameters.toolDescription: Retrieve data from the Pinecone knowledge base and use it to answer user queries about the company, products, or projects in a well-structured, human-like manner

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
